title: PID Control Function Block
description: This function block implements a PID (Proportional, Integral, Derivative) control algorithm. It takes several input parameters for control settings and generates an output based on the control loop calculations. The block handles limits, manual control, and resetting of the PID controller.
name: CTRL_PID

input.name: ACT
input.description: The actual value from the process being controlled.

input.name: SET
input.description: The desired setpoint for the process variable.

input.name: SUP
input.description: A supplementary input for additional control.

input.name: OFS
input.description: Offset value for the controller output.

input.name: M_I
input.description: Manual input value for control when in manual mode.

input.name: MAN
input.description: Manual control flag; when true, overrides the automatic control.

input.name: RST
input.description: Reset flag for the PID controller.

input.name: KP
input.description: Proportional gain of the PID controller.

input.name: TN
input.description: Integral time constant of the PID controller.

input.name: TV
input.description: Derivative time constant of the PID controller.

input.name: LL
input.description: Lower limit for the controller output.

input.name: LH
input.description: Upper limit for the controller output.

output.name: Y
output.description: Output value of the PID controller.

output.name: DIFF
output.description: Difference between setpoint and actual value.

output.name: LIM
output.description: Indicator whether the output is within defined limits.
